seedGroups.name: Shattering
seedGroups.description: Shattering seeds can be tough to visually judge for ripeness. Use a *gentle* touch test to see if the seeds easily loosen.

species.description: Shattering. The sepals cup around the hairy seeds, hidden under the leaves and pointing downhill. Seeds are ripe when they fall off with a *gentle* touch; no force is necessary. Must sow fresh and viability is often low. Hepatica are some of the earliest flowers of the year.
